editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A34590 of text R15454 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing C6324). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 250 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 53 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The Feign'd astrologer a comedie.
titleStmt.author: Calderón de la Barca, Pedro, 1600-1681. Astrologo fingido.
Corneille, Thomas, 1625-1709. Feint astrologue.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
As adaption by an unknown translator of Thomas Corneille's "Le feint astrologue," which was founded on Calderon's "El astrologo fingido."

ep:epHeader.ep:title: The Feigned Astrologer
ep:epHeader.ep:defectRangePerGrade: The rate of 9.59 defects per 10,000 words puts this text in the B category of texts with fewer than 10 defects per 10,000 words.
